byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis reported from Washington, and Michael R. Gordon from New York.
byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Pres Obama and Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe reach agreement on military cooperation that allows Japan to act when United States or countries under its protection are threatened, rather than solely in self-defense.
lead_paragraph: The new guidelines, which envision an expanded role for Japanese forces, were announced a day before Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan was to visit the White House.

headline.main: Japan and U.S. Set New Rules for Military Cooperation
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Japan Tighten Military Cooperation

snippet: The new guidelines, which envision an expanded role for Japanese forces, were announced a day before Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan was to visit the White House.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
